metadata.title: CVE-2022-1292 on Ubuntu 22.04 FIPS Undergoing Certification (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
The c_rehash script does not properly sanitise shell metacharacters toprevent command injection. This script is distributed by some operatingsystems in a manner where it is automatically executed. On such operatingsystems, an attacker could execute arbitrary commands with the privilegesof the script. Use of the c_rehash script is considered obsolete and shouldbe replaced by the OpenSSL rehash command line tool. Fixed in OpenSSL 3.0.3(Affected 3.0.0,3.0.1,3.0.2). Fixed in OpenSSL 1.1.1o (Affected1.1.1-1.1.1n). Fixed in OpenSSL 1.0.2ze (Affected 1.0.2-1.0.2zd).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-1292` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libssl3 - 3.0.2-0ubuntu1.1
openssl - 3.0.2-0ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

libnode72 - 12.22.9~dfsg-1ubuntu3.1
nodejs - 12.22.9~dfsg-1ubuntu3.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openssl package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.0.2-0ubuntu1.1').
nodejs package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '12.22.9~dfsg-1ubuntu3.1').
